Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Noel Ramesh Aloysius  Noel is a great TA for the class.
Instructor: Noel Ramesh Aloysius  Didn't really need to work with him. Helpful
Instructor: Noel Ramesh Aloysius  N/A
Instructor: Noel Ramesh Aloysius  Noel was the only TA for the class.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: N/A
There were only one two and half hour meeting session per week for this class, and therefore a lot of materials could not be covered at an in-depth level.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: the material is up to date and relevant. I also appreciate the technical aspect of the material.
understand the framework for risk analysis and was exposed to some tools for the analysis
Some intersing topics (nuclear, toxic assessment, etc.) and some practical skills (risk assessment software).
We are allowed to choose our topics for final papers which can be a good lead into research for masters thesis. The time spent on this paper was very valuable.
The instructor really showed appreciation for whatever the students did.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: more field trips will be great
Lectures - sometimes lectures were not well organized (too detailed or not enough). HW assingments - not really helpful and did not see the point of them.
I would like to be able to practically apply some of the theories and concepts from within class through problem sets.

Balance on the depth and breadth of materials. I however understand that this may be due to the fact that many classmates do not have a strong technical background so the instructor had to take everyone's ability in to account.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: N/A
Discussions were well integrated into lectures.

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Noel Ramesh Aloysius  Noel has been responsive and helpful. I hope he could interact with students in the class more.
Instructor: Noel Ramesh Aloysius  N/A

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course was great, I learned a lot of material that will help me in the field.
An elective for my concentration
Gained some helpful skills and basic understanding of risk assessment.
The content covered were essential for my future career as an environmental consultant.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To learn how to perform a risk assessment and I got what i was looking for.
interested in the subject matter as it is very practical and necessary for environmental consulting work
to gain skills and risk assessment knowledge

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes, I was very pleased with every aspect of this course.
yes
For most parts.

I would personally want to see more depth (maybe the final project could be shaped so that the students have to work on a risk-related scenario using one of the risk-assessing software/tools presented in class)?

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: N/A

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Professor Khalil was great! The class wasn't too demanding but I learned a lot. I would recommend this class to anyone.
To take it, the work is manageable, diverse in scope and interesting. Professor Khalil is entertaining and I think that he understands what are important skills for future risk assessors to learn.
take good notes in class
N/A
